Fixed in JavaRuntime. Released to 3.2.1 as well.

I verified we persist/restore non-ascii characters properly now using UTF8, for default VM args. However, retrieving a property with a non-ascii character does not seem to work properly (i.e. System.out.println(System.getProperty("x"));). This is because the VM is launched from the host process, using the system encoding. So, the non-ascii character is not sent to the command line properly. I don't see a fix to that. The command line will only understand characters in the current system encoding.
